hero.title: A Decentralized Gaming Ecosystem Made By Players.
hero.text: Take your creative freedom to the next level & monetize it in the blockchain! Create & Play!

partners.title: Amazing partners are working with us!

sandbox.title: What is the Sandbox?
sandbox.text: The Sandbox is a community-driven game ecosystem that empowers game makers to create, publish and monetize a myriad of unique experiences on a decentralized platform with cryptocurrency payments. Players can create and sell individual voxel objects, or ASSETS, and also combine ASSETS they make or acquire into a highly customizable game world called a BOX to create their own gaming experiences they can enjoy, share, and sell. With the support of creators around the world, our goal is to make The Sandbox the new standard in world-building games, with millions of user-created 3D voxel assets and games available as NFTs on the blockchain.

items.title: Sell & trade your creations!
items.text: Publish your voxel creations on the blockchain!  Our open market will allow for the free trading of in-game NFT assets in The Sandbox and between different platform users. For example, game developers can acquire assets on The Sandbox and incorporate them into their own games.

items.title: Create your own voxel assets and gaming worlds!
items.text: We are empowering creators with easy to use yet powerful content creation tools.  Our Editor allows anyone to make 3D voxel objects (or import their existing creations), animate them (frame by frame or skeleton-based) and turn them into NFTs to freely share or sell.

items.title: Blockchain + IPFS
items.subtitle: Step-by-step blockchain implementation process, starting with decentralization of particular gameplay elements, resulting in a full decentralization of the gaming experience over time.

items.title: User Generated Content
items.subtitle: Content will be created by the community with The Sandbox VoxEditor as well as imported from existing tools such as MagicaVoxel.

items.title: Non-Fungible Tokens
items.subtitle: User-generated content will become ERC-721 non-fungible tokens (ASSETs) for the community to monetize & trade their creativity.

items.title: Multiplayer
items.subtitle: Creators will be able to add multiplayer elements to the BOX worlds they create, allowing the community to share experiences with their friends through online gaming experiences!

items.title: Battle Royale
items.description: Drop down to this island and prepare for a frenzied battle! You and 49 other players will all be trying to survive and be the last man standing, are you up for the challenge?

items.title: Racing
items.description: Feel the adrenaline of the speed course through your veins! These helicopter races will test your reflexes to the limit in order to see who is the very best!

items.title: Adventure
items.description: In a world reigned by darkness and chaos, only the chosen one will be able to save us all from evil. Are you the hero we need? There is only one way to find out...

items.title: Social Game
items.description: Who would have guessed that partying with friends and dinosaurs would be so much fun? Come and meet lots of new friends in this wacky and goofy town!

items.title: Crafting
items.description: New customers are coming and they want all sorts of weapons and armours, but your assistant has gone missing! Go into the wild, collect resources for the customer’s orders and find out what happened to your trusty assistant in this epic journey!

items.title: Sports
items.description: Is your team ready to challenge other footvox legends in this unique 3vs3 competitive sports!? Climb to the top and become the world championship winner to win great prizes!

items.title: RPG
items.description: In the kingdom of Glaernam, people fight each other to decide who will be the next supreme commander of the land. Gear up and show everyone what you’ve got in this persistent open world arena challenge!

items.title: Gambling
items.description: Are you feeling lucky tonight? Let’s take lady luck for a game of lucky dice then! Choose a number, throw the dice and win amazing prizes!

items.title: Shooter
items.description: People have gone crazy, horrible creatures have started to show up everywhere, and your squad is nowhere to be found. It all started when that ancient portal activated. You will have to find a way to shut it down!

team.title: The company
team.text: Pixowl has previously raised $2M with notable investors and is backed by top industry advisors.
team.paragraph: Founded in 2011 and headquartered in San Francisco, with development studios in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Pixowl, Inc. is a mobile game development company that creates and combines player-centric worldbuilding experiences and character-driven narratives. Pixowl’s experienced international team of dynamic innovators give mobile and PC gamers the ability to build worlds featuring both original and IP-based content.

items.name: Arthur Madrid
items.description: Longtime social-gaming entrepreneur. Sold two software companies (Wixi Inc. and 1-Click Media). Arthur is advisor for several startups in gaming, social media and software.

items.name: Sebastien Borget
items.description: Seb is a recognized speaker and evangelist who spent the past 6 years focused exclusively on creating successful mobile games.

items.name: Pablo Iglesias
items.description: Ten years of experience researching and developing emergent procedural systems while leading teams of professionals through several successful games.

items.name: Lucas Shrewsbury
items.position: CTO of Pixowl, ex-CTO of Gameloft
items.description: Lucas has spent more than a decade leading mobile gaming studios. While at Gameloft Argentina, he managed the studio and a team of 200 people.

items.name: Marcelo Santurio
items.description: Former Regional Director at PokerStars. Co-founder of the 1st online payment company in Latam and +20 years experience in Finance, Tech and Gaming.

items.name: Ed Fries
items.description: VP of @Microsoft. Created his first video games for the Atari 800 in the early 1980s. Created Microsoft Game Studios, co-founded the Xbox project, and made Microsoft one of the leaders in the video game business.

items.name: Mick Nayeem
items.description: Lover of Crypto & Games and Cats! Founder and CEO of Fuel Powered, a venture-backed liveops platform acquired by Animoca Brands.

items.name: Federico Cardoso
items.description: Hard-working and enthusiastic entrepreneur.Strong background in network and software architecture, security and cryptography.

items.name: Mathieu Nouzareth
items.description: Co-founded 5 internet companies since 1995 (sold 2 and 1 went public). Creator of SongPop hit game

items.name: Yat Siu
items.position: Co-Founder and CEO at Animoca Brands
items.description: Serial entrepreneur and angel investor. CEO and Founder of Outblaze (sold B2B business to IBM in 2009), he has received recognition for his role as an entrepreneur focused on Internet and technology companies.

items.name: Pablo Ruiz
items.description: Ethereum Blockchain & Smart Contracts Consultant Building the Next-generation Standard for Blockchain-based Securities Tokens

items.name: Allen Ng
items.description: 5 years of venture building, investment and M&A experience.

items.name: Robby Yung
items.description: Started several businesses in China and Hong Kong, including those in mobile telecoms and software applications, cable television, internet services, outdoor advertising, and publishing.

items.name: Wilhelm Taht
items.description: Track record as commercial and strategic leader in global media & software organizations and start-ups. Extensive network in media, games & music industries.

items.name: Holly Liu
items.description: Holly Liu founded the venture backed mobile gaming company, Kabam in 2006 with UC Berkeley alumni.

items.name: Ronan Sandford
items.description: Created Etherplay in 2016, the first blockchain skill-based games platform offering ETH rewards pools on a pay to play model. Over 3 years experience in Blockchain games development and 8 in video game industry

items.name: Thibault Simar
items.description: 2D/3D artist specialized in motion design, addicted to voxels. Founder of Voxelmade.com.

items.name: Andres Soechting
items.description: Producer | Startup CTO | Product Developer | Game Designer

items.name: Leon Isla
items.description: Solidity Developer - Game Developer - Full Stack Web Developer

items.name: Martin Martelletti
items.description: Over 4 years of experience creating interactive experiences for multiple platforms and genres. Wide knowledge of blockchain environment.

items.name: Lucas Uema
items.description: Crypto-enthusiast involved in Mobile Games Project Management & Marketing.

items.name: Damián Volantino
items.description: UX/UI Designer - Blockchain Technical Designer with 9+ years of experience in the gaming industry.

items.title: What is The Sandbox?
items.description: The Sandbox is user-generated content platform powered by blockchain technology where creators will be able to craft, play, share and trade without central control, enjoying secure copyright ownership with the ability to earn cryptocurrency!

items.title: How is The Sandbox different?
items.description: Existing voxel games are highly centralized and do not allow voxel artists to receive the full value for their work. The Sandbox is taking a unique decentralized and user-centric approach to offer more to artists.

items.title: What is the $SAND Token?
items.description: Pixowl is introducing “SAND”, a new cryptocurrency based on Ethereum´s ERC-20 token standard. It will give millions of voxel artists and game creators the required tools to generate revenue from their virtual creations on The Sandbox platform and marketplace. SAND tokens will allow creators to buy & trade several types of unique digital assets in the form of non-fungible tokens supported by the ERC-721 standard. They will be available on The Sandbox platform. SAND will allow users to begin trading user-generated content in the marketplace. At first, these tokens will be acquirable through an Initial Coin Offering in the future.

items.title: Are you raising funds?
items.description: We are beginning the Private Sale and aiming to build a community of smart investors who will be engaged with the project and help with strategic decisions; we are not just looking for financial investment.

items.title: Are you accepting other cryptocurrencies such as EOS for your fundraising?
items.description: We are open to accepting other main crypto-currencies as long as they are traded in the largest exchanges.

items.title: How does The Sandbox platform generate Revenue after the Token Sale?
items.description:
Revenue in The Sandbox will be generated through three streams:
- Transaction Fees: Creators will receive 100% of the selling price they set for their creations, with The Sandbox charging a small commision based on the asset selling price to the buyer on top of this to support marketplace upkeep and for the development of new features.
- Content sales: While in-game creators will create a large percentage of items in the game, Pixowl will also create core assets that can be sold to players. These assets will be of high quality and will form the ‘building blocks’ many players will use initially.
- In-game Advertising: Billboards and click-through ads will be available. In addition, opportunities for branded or theme worlds—for instance, a world dedicated to an upcoming film—will be made available to license holders for a negotiated fee.

items.title: Why don’t you sell BOX tokens in the private / pre-sale, instead of (or in addition of) SAND
items.description:
SAND is the main token of The Sandbox ecosystem and the only one based on the ERC-20 standard; it is our intention to make it the only fungible token and sole currency of the ecosystem. Without it, users will not be able to publish ASSETS or BOXES in the marketplace.
- If we sell BOXES in other currency such as ETH or BTC it would decrease the utility and value of SAND.

items.title: Is $SAND a utility token?
items.description: SAND is a utility token since it gives access to all the diferent products in the marketplace to potential users of the platform. It also gives players access to any special features or content on BOXES through microtransactions or subscriptions.

items.title: Does the $SAND token allow transaction fees to be reduced?
items.description: The $SAND token could have various applications inside The Sandbox ecosystem. Transaction fees are however separate from the commission charged on top of the asset price that goes to its creator.

items.title: Can Players mint the $SAND token?
items.description: Inittially, during the ICO phase, SAND will be minted by our smart contract directly to the investors. Once the ICO phase is over, players will be able to earn SAND as reward for multiple actions such as winning challenges, selling creations, or winning battle royale games.

items.title: What are the different Token Sale phases?
items.description:
We will have an initial $SAND supply of 1,000,000,000 $SAND. From this, we will sell 50% of the supply (i.e., 500,000,000 tokens) executed in the following phases:
- Private Sales: Initial sales will see the distribution of 59,438,187 tokens.
- Pre-Sale: Second sale of 163,169,303 tokens.
- Public Sales: Third and last sale of tokens. The amount available will be 277,392,510 tokens.

items.title: How much is the $SAND token worth?
items.description: Initially 1 $SAND will be worth US$0.07210.

items.title: Why are ASSETS limited?
items.description: ASSETS are non fungible tokens based on the ERC-721 standard and are thus NOT limited. However, we do charge a small fee upon upload to the marketplace to discourage low quality ASSETS and even copycats. This small fee will be more than covered by creators when they sell their ASSETS for a profit.

items.title: Why will ASSETS increase in value?
items.description: There are many factors that can affect ASSET prices, just as goods are affected in other marketplaces. For example, if the ASSET creator becomes well known demand for his or her creations may increase, driving up the value. If a game style becomes popular and many BOXES are being created to feature it, ASSETS that work well in that game style may go up in demand and price. Other factors such as seasonal demand can increase the value of certain assets, e.g., during Halloween pumpkins, ghosts, bats, etc. could see increased demand and thus go up in value.

items.title: Why are BOXES limited?
items.description: BOXES are non fungible tokens based on the ERC-721 standard and are thus NOT limited. We will, however, release fixed amounts of BOXES with special properties, called Gen[N] BOXES, where [N] is the number of the generation, starting at 0. The lower the number of the generation of the BOX, the higher the revenue percentage of in-game sales that will go to creators. For example, a Gen[0] BOX gives 100% of the proceeds to the creator while higher gen numbers give an exponentially lower percentage. Market price will determine the value of these BOXES, and as time passes and more creators seek these Gen[0] BOX, the higher their value will be, so it's best to acquire them at the very beginning.

items.title: Why would BOXES increase in value?
items.description:
Each and every BOX is different in its contents, but what will make them truly unique is the potential content users can create inside it.

A BOX gains value as creators fill their BOX with different assets and scripts in the future to make varied, interesting gaming experiences available.

If at any point a player wishes to sell their BOX, they will be able to offer the full customized package in the marketplace to any other player willing to buy it.

items.title: Can ASSETS and BOXES be traded on alternative marketplaces?
items.description:
There can be interoperability between Marketplaces.
We will develop our API and give full support to the most important Marketplaces like OPSkins, giving creators and players the possibility to have several ways to market their creations.

items.title: Where are you on the Roadmap?
items.description:
We are beginning the first phase of the roadmap for The Sandbox on the blockchain, which is about:
- Making the VoxEdit tool available for Creators to make 3D voxel models and publish them as NFTs
- Deploying an online marketplace which will allow players and creators to trade NFTs and collect them in prevision of including them into their BOX worlds for creating immersive game experiences

items.title: Why is the blockchain required?
items.description: Pixowl’s belief is that a properly integrated blockchain-based system can vastly improve both the creative user experience and economic dynamic of games with User Generated Content (UGC). By itself, such a blockchain system doesn’t make the game look any better, load any faster, or magically become more exciting to play. But when implemented into an entertaining game (which provides a fun place to play) with a large community (which provides an audience to sell and trade with) it can coalesce the experience into a more satisfying, coherent whole that can reward both players and developers.

items.title: Is our Token interoperable with other platforms or games?
items.description: We have our sights set on the potential benefits of interoperability, and so we are planning to allow other crypto-games and marketplaces to make use of and benefit from our $SAND token. This will allow the organic creation of an ecosystem where $SAND stands in the center of it as the main payment currency and ASSETS and BOX are the main tradeable products between different platforms.

items.title: How can other developers join The Sandbox platform?
items.description: Our BOXES will support scripts and developers only have to focus on creating original and fun experiences and publishing them on our platform, where they will have the possibility of generating cryptocurrency earnings.

items.title: When will the game be launching?
items.description: We are currently hard at work developing features like a user-generated content non-fungible token marketplace for creators, and the VoxEdit editor for importing or making new creations from scratch. We are also researching the possibility to add several more features, like the possibility to share a social experience with your friends inside a BOX in real time, and building upon that feature, for creators to be able to add their own gameplay mechanics and systems through scripting tools.

items.title: Why can't Minecraft or Roblox do what we are doing?
items.description: Both Minecraft & Roblox have platform versions where blockchain is not supported and would require a re-engineering of their entire monetization model. The Sandbox integrates Blockchain from the ground up in a natural evolution for creators and players.
